page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: This area of land is in the North-East of Scotland, just south of the Moray Firth. It is very flat, only rising to fifteen metres. The land is badly drained, when it rains heavily you often see water lying in the fields. The only major road leads from Lossiemouth to Elgin. The others are minor. The airfield covers one-quarter of the land, and two-thirds of the area is farmland. There are two cemeteries, only one is being used, the other is old. Until twenty years ago there was a railway, but it is closed now. Most housing can be found on the two council estates with only a minority of private housing. There used to be a quarry which is now a park. There are two caravan sites.
